G4810-d-06-25-00-WC.Narrative: TRAIN FL075, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 6 LOADS AND 15 EMPTIES, WAS LINING UP THE TRAIN.  THERE WERE 3 CARS STANDING ON THE HIGH END OF THE UP LEAD WHEN THE CREW KICKED 1 CAR INTO THE STANDING CUT OF CARS.  THE CAR APPEARED TO HIT THE STANDING CUT OF CARS AND "SLOSH BACK".  THE CONDUCTOR THEN LINED THE SWITCH AND HAD THE ENGINEER SHOVE BACK TO JOINT ON WC 3 TRACK.  HE PUT 3 CARS TO ANOTHER TRACK, SHOVED BACK AND STARTED TO PULL THE TRAIN 738 WHEN THE CAR KICKED INTO THE UP LEAD HAD ROLLED BACKAND HIT THE SIDE OF THEIR TRAIN.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT REVEALED THAT THE CONDUCTOR FAILED TO INSURE THAT CAR UTLX 802772 HAD COUPLED TO THE STANDING CARS ON THE TRACK THUS ALLOWING IT TO ROLL OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF FL075.  UTLX802772 WAS ONTO ITS SIDE IN THE INCIDENT AND 5 CARS ON TRAIN FL075 SUSTAINED DAMAGED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4811-d-06-26-00-WC.Narrative: WISCONSIN CENTRAL TRAIN, BRFDIT, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVVS, 25 LOADS AND 50 EMPTIES, PULLING THEIRTRAIN AT APPROXIMATELY 10MPH FROM THE BRC'S WEST DEPARTURE TRACK WHEN CAR GATX 50318 PICKED A FLOATING SWITCH.  GATX 50318 WAS AN EMPTY HARARDOUS CAR THAT DERAILED AND PULLED THE FOLLOWING THREE CARSOFF WITH IT.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE SWITCH WAS NOT SECURED OR LOCKED ALLOWING IT TO OPEN AS THE CARS WENT OVER IT.  THE WISCONSIN CENTRAL CREW DID NOT LINE THIS SWITCH NOR DID THEY HAVE TO WALK PAST IT WHILE PERFOEMING THEIR WORK. G4808-d-06-07-00-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, YARD JOB - Y3431 - HAD KICKED 12 CARS (4 LOADS AND 8 EMPTIES) INTO TRACK 6.  THE CARS DID NOT COUPLE AND THE CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE EAST END WITH 2 HAND BRAKES APPLIED.  THE CREW THEN LEFT TRAK 6 TO GO TO TRACK 9 TO PULL IT.  AT THE TIME CREW WAS PULLING 2 LOADS AND19 EMPTIES FROM TRACK 9, THE COUPLED CARS ON TRACK 6 ROLLED BACK AND SIDESWIPED THEIR TRAIN.  ONE CAR WAS DERAILED (THE HEAD CAR OUT OF TRACK 6) AND 2 TANK CARS ON TRACK 9 WERE DAMAGED.  INVESTIGATIONINTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT WHILE THE CONDUCTOR HAD PROTECTED HIS SHOVE MOVE, THE CARS DID COUPLETHUR ALLOWING THEM TO ROLL BACK INTO THE SIDE OF THIER NEXT MOVEMENT.  THE CONDUCTOR DID NOT CONTROLHIS PROTECTED SHOVE.  TRACK WAS NOT DAMAGED..NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4809-d-06-18-00-WC.Narrative: WISCONSIN CENTRAL TRAIN, T040-18; CONSISTING OF 1 ENGINE, 37 LOADS AND 9 EMPTIES, WAS PULLING EAST INTO THE IHB'S NORPAUL YARD ON TRACK 19 AT APPROXIMATELY 9 MPH.  THE CREW WAS CLOSE TO THE SOUTH ENDOF THE TRACK WHEN THEY FELT A TUG FROM THE REAR OF THEIR TRAIN.  THEY LOOKED BACK AND SAW A CLOUD OFDUST AND DIRT, THE AIR THEN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND THE TRAIN WAS STOPPED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THEINCIDENT FOUND THAT A DEFECTIVE SWITCH POINT CAUSED CAR - WC 87048 - TO CLIMB THE POINT AND DERAIL PULLING 4 OTHER CARS OFF WITH IT.  THE DERAILMENT CAUSED DAMAGE TO BOTH TRACKS 18 AND 19 ON THE IHB.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

YARD FOREMAN NOTED PIN DROP AND CARS REMAINED COUPLED WHEN CARS STOPPED.  DID NOT STRETCH SLACK IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION.  HUMP CREWS ADVISED TO ALWAYS STRETCH SLACK IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION OF MOVEMENTAFTER COUPLING TO OR RECOUPLING TO CARS.  UNABLE TO DETERMINE THROUGH EXAMINATION OF CARS WHETHER ORNOT CARS WERE COUPLED TOGETHER PRIOR TO MOVEMENT OVER THE HUMP. 200004-d-06-23-00-ESHR.Primary Accident Cause: Vandalism of on-track equipment, e.g., brakes released
200004-d-06-23-00-ESHR.Accident Cause: Vandalism of on-track equipment, e.g., brakes released
200004-d-06-23-00-ESHR.Narrative: ON 6/23/00,  VANDAL(S) STOLE ESHR OWNED BEB-17 BALLAST REGULATOR VALUED AT $30.000.  THIS MACHINE HAD BEEN PLACED IN A SIDING (ESHR MP 35.6) BY THE OPERATOR AT 4 P.M ON 6/22/00.  THE KEYS TO THE MACHINE WERE PLACED ABOVE THE DOOR, THE "POWER-ON" SWITCH TURNED OFF, BRAKES WERE SET AND THE SWITCHES WERE LOCKED AND LINED FOR THE MAIN.  THE VANDAL(S) SOMEHOW GOT THE MACHINE STARTED AND SOMEHOW MOVED THE MACHINE OUT OF THE SIDING ONTO THE MAINLINE, PUT THE MACHINE IN GEAR AND JUMPED-OFF.  THE MACHINETRAVELED NORTH ON THE MAINLINE FOR APPROX.  5 MILES TO POCOMOKE CITY, MD AND WENT INTO THE POCOMOKERIVER BECAUSE THE SWING BRIDGE AT THIS LOCATION WAS OPEN.  NOTE: THE TRACKAGE & SWING BRIDGE ARE OWNED BY NS.  THE MACHINE WAS TOTAL LOSS.  THIS INCIDENT IS STILL UNDER INVESTIGATION BOTH INTERNALLYAND BY THE MARYLAND STATE POLICE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
